'''Darkening of Valinor''' was the destruction of the [[Two Trees of Valinor]]
column2: by [[Morgoth]] and [[Ungoliant]] in {{YT|1495}}. The fifty [[Valian Years]] between the Darkening and the rising of the [[Sun]] was known as the '''Long Night'''.<ref>{{S|Sun}}</ref>

column1: After Melkor sowed discord among the [[Noldor]] and fled Valinor
column2: [[Manwë]] held a feast for the reconciliation of the Eldar. There [[Fingolfin]] publicly forgave [[Fëanor]]. In the meantime
column3: the Dark Lord found [[Ungoliant]] in [[Avathar]] and asked her aid against his enemies. Ungoliant helped Melkor infiltrate Valinor by shrouding both herself and her ally in webs of pure darkness. Once within Valinor
column4: Ungoliant drank the light from the Two Trees after Morgoth wounded them with his spear. She also drained dry the Wells of Varda so that nothing remained of the Light of the Two Lamps save that of the Silmarils of Fëanor.<ref>{{S|8}}</ref>

column1: {{quote|Then the Unlight of Ungoliant rose up even to the roots of the Trees
column2: and Melkor sprang upon the mound; and with his black spear he smote each Tree to its core
column4: and their sap poured forth as it were their blood
column5: and was spilled upon the ground. But Ungoliant sucked it up
column6: and going then from Tree to Tree she set her black beak to their wounds
column7: till they were drained; and the poison of Death that was in her went into their tissues and withered them
column9: branch and leaf; and they died.|[[The Silmarillion]]

column2: Ungoliant and Melkor fled to escape justice at the hands of the Valar. They killed [[Finwë]] in [[Formenos]] and stole the [[Silmarils]]. Enraged
column3: [[Fëanor]] refused to surrender the Silmarils to revive the [[Two Trees]]
column4: and when he learned about their theft
column5: he rebelled against the [[Valar]]. He persuaded many Elves to go with him to [[Middle-earth]] and the [[Flight of the Noldor]] began
column6: but when he demanded the [[swan-ships]] of the [[Falmari]]
column7: he resolved to the [[First Kinslaying]] to steal them. This event caused the [[Fall of the Noldor]].

column2: [[Mandos]] (or his messenger) appeared before them and spoke the [[Doom of Mandos]]. [[Finarfin]] abandoned the host
column3: but the [[Sons of Fëanor]] responded with the [[Oath of Fëanor]].

column2: [[Orcs]] besieged the [[Havens of the Falas]]; the [[First Battle of Beleriand]] occurred. The [[Sindar]] withdrew in [[Doriath]]
column3: inside the [[Girdle of Melian]] that was set around. The [[Laiquendi]] also remained hidden. Soon after
column4: the Noldor arrived and Feanor was killed in the [[Dagor-nuin-Giliath]]. [[Maedhros]] was also captured and chained on the [[Thangorodrim]]. The Noldor refused to depart and camped at [[Mithrim]].
